Author: heyfolksletsparty
Text: I also struggle a lot with my body image and literal, physical body. It's difficult to deal with because there's BDD and then there's just genuinely finding your body unattractive.  In theory, from what I know of the HAES perspective, relief from self hatred is the hardest part and the last to come. I'm not very educated on this, but the way therapists have expressed it to me before is that as continue to make good choices, care for our bodies, eat and exercise intuitively, and also work on not assigning all the inportance on our physical appearance, it will gradually lose some of its importance.   That shift also takes a lot of work, though, and we have to keep pushing back on negative self talk and unhealthy thoughts to change it.   I think that /r/fuckeatingdisorders may be a better fit for you, they are super recovery minded and though I love this sub, it seems like they might be more of what you're looking for.
